page.title: 16Fishpond Lock
page.content: On the way to{Fishpond Lock}the road was stony and the area around it was mostly waste land, with weeds and rubbish. There were many wild flowers. We also passed an old{railway bridge which was used for carrying rubbish to the waste land. We then met the{lock keeper.}He was in an office where he operated the lock. We saw a few boats go through the lock and then we asked him some questions. We asked him which boats went down the lock and he told us he gets 600 ton{tankers,}belonging to Petrofina and Elf, which bring petrol from the{River Humber}to storage depots at{Knostrop.}The other boats that go down are pleasure boats and barges. The locks are operated by {electronic and hydraulic power.
